text:
Graeme Frank Langlands (1 September 1941 – 20 January 2018) was an Australian professional rugby league player. He played for the St. George Dragons as a fullback, winning premierships in 1963, 1964, 1965 and 1966. He also played for the New South Wales and national teams. He was one of the "Immortals" of rugby league. He was born in Wollongong.
Langlands died of problems caused by dementia on 20 January 2018 in Sutherland, New South Wales. He was 76.
